name: AJAX
description: Overview of different terms associated with AJAX

AJAX Request Methods.val: Open a connection to a URL; method = HTTP verb (GET, POST, etc.); url = url to open, may include querystring; async = whether to make asynchronous request
Assign a function object as callback
Add a header to the HTTP request
Send the request body = string to be used as request body
Stop the request from listening for the response
Stage in lifecycle of response (only populated after send() is called)
The HTTP return code (integer, only populated after response reaches the loaded state)
Body of response as a JavaScript string (only set after response reaches the interative readyState)
Body of response as a XML document object (only set after response reaches the interactive readyState)
Read a response header by name
Get an array of all response header names

Common Mime Types.val: Implies that body is an encoded querystring of key-value pairs
Implies that body is an XML document
Implies that body is plain unformatted text
Implies that body is a piece of JavaScript code
Implies that body is a binary image

Common HTTP Verbs.val: Add a new object instance to the domain model
Get an existing domain object from the server
Remove an existing object from the domain model
